title.0: Allow overriding the default shell on Windows
title.4: [cli] Add telemetry for `vercel teams invite email1, email2`
title.6: Cannot add litteral array with SetUnion
title.7: Can llama3.2 vision accept no image?
title.9: fix: Commitlint has path error when cloning proj onto a Linux Machine
title.10: fix: <title> type-enum inside RuleConfigSeverity.Error is not working.
title.11: getSchemas with empty string for schemaPattern returns schemas, violating JDBC spec
title.12: memory.swap.max == max contrary to systemctl show/expectation
title.13: systemd-machined can be crashed by calling the List varlink method
title.14: `static` global functions in headers interferes with use of modules
title.15: basic_stream's (websocket::stream) async_connect compilation (type not convertible) failure introduced between Boost 1.85.0 and Boost 1.86.0
title.16: BUG: "python make.py html" for documentation is giving error
title.17: :Git command fails with an error `Can't open file syntax/diff.vim`
title.18: Prisma client's `.$connect()` does not throw any error when database is not reachable on startup
title.19: Inconsistent column data: Could not convert value false of the field `receiveemails` to type `Decimal`
title.20: Create customer portal session with flow subscription_update - property 'subscription_update' does not exist in type 'FlowData'

body.0:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
On Unix, I can `chsh` the default shell to my preferred shell and Hyper will honor that.

On Windows, there's no way to configure a default shell, as far as I can tell. I've tried overriding the COMSPEC variable, but that has no effect on Hyper.

I'd like not to have to configure the default shell in the configuration file as I'd like to re-use the same configuration file that I use on other platforms.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Ideally, the user could configure something in the environment to change the default shell (e.g. DEFAULT_SHELL=%userprofile%/.local/bin/myshell.exe), and Hyper would honor that.
body.1:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

I use some hyper config that I'd like to share across Windows and Unix hosts. Since Windows generally supports forward slashes, it would be nice if Hyper would do the same when on Windows, allowing a config to be shared across platforms. For example:

```
    shell: '/Users/jaraco/.local/bin/xonsh.exe',
```

That config doesn't work on Windows and will cause a crash, even if that file exists. Only after translating the forward slashes to backslashes does the application run.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Better would be to honor forward slashes on all platforms, making the configuration files more portable. That could be done by translating the forward slashes to backslashes before passing them to Windows APIs... or more likely those paths can simply be used with forward slashes and Hyper merely needs to avoid crashing when forward slashes are supplied on Windows.
body.2:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I'd like to be able to share my hyper config without having to customize it to each host, but due to corporate restrictions, my username must be different on these different hosts. Therefore, the shell configuration variable must necessarily be different on each machine. For example:

```
    shell: '\\Users\\jaraco\\.local\\bin\\xonsh.exe',
```

```
    shell: '\\Users\\jaraco2\\.local\\bin\\xonsh.exe',
```

If the hyper configuration would allow for home-relative paths, it would make it possible to declare this config in one way on both hosts:

```
    shell: '~\\.local\\bin\\xonsh.exe',
```


**Describe the solution you'd like**

For any config item that references a path, allow the path to contain `~` and expand it to the user's home directory.
body.3:
I used `0x` to trace it and its a glob issue.

The issue is `cwd = /`. This is used for globbing which means its searches the entire file system.

```
export async function getWorkspaces({
  fs,
  depth = MAX_DEPTH_TRAVERSE,
  cwd = '/',
}: GetWorkspaceOptions): Promise<Workspace[]> {
  if (depth === 0) return [];

  const workspaceType = await detectWorkspaceManagers({
    fs,
    frameworkList: workspaceManagers,
  });

  if (workspaceType === null) {
    const directoryContents = await fs.readdir('./');
    const childDirectories = directoryContents.filter(
      stat => stat.type === 'dir'
    );

    return (
      await Promise.all(
        childDirectories.map(childDirectory =>
          getWorkspaces({
            fs: fs.chdir(childDirectory.path),
            depth: depth - 1,
            cwd: posixPath.join(cwd, childDirectory.path),
          })
        )
      )
    ).flat();
  }

  return [
    {
      type: workspaceType as WorkspaceType,
      rootPath: cwd,
    },
  ];
}

```

Globs...

```
repos/**/package.json
tools/**/package.json
!**/.vercel/**/package.json
!**/.venv/**/package.json
!**/+archive/**/package.json
!**/static/**/package.json
```

body.4: Additional telemetry (and minimal test setup to run) for `vercel teams invite`
body.5:
In the discussion of potential solutions for #4808, one idea was to add a `resolver` attribute to the `@Meta` annotation that could…
- either take a SpEL expression returning a fully populated `Meta` instance to be used for the query execution
- or refer to a named bean implementing a dedicated interface `MetaResolver.resolve(RepositoryMethodContext)` so that implementations get access to the full method

I guess both could be supported at the same time, but we might end up adding only one of the options.
body.6:
Hello,

Using SetOperators.SetUnion:

`SetOperators.arrayAsSet("aField").union("anotherField")`

How can I reproduce this expression that works fine in Mongo, when one field is a single value and needs to be wrapped in square brackets:

`$setUnion: [ "$arrayOfStringField", [ "$stringField" ] ]`

Thanks

I have been trying to expermint with the model and see how it works.

My question is:

OR
`ValueError: No image were provided, but there are image tokens in the prompt`

body.9:
### Steps to Reproduce

```bash
1. Clone a project where Commitlint was initialized on a Windows machine.
Here is my config file
`commitlint.config.js`
`module.exports = { extends: ['@commitlint/config-conventional'] }`


2. Clone the project onto a Linux machine
```


### Current Behavior

When committing, it successfully completes all steps then on the last step, I get an `errno` of `-2`

> file:///home/username/Documents/Coding/projectDir/node_modules/@commitlint/cli/lib/cli.js:127
>         throw err;
>         ^
> 
> [Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/home/username/Documents/Coding/projectDir/\'] {
>   errno: -2,
>   code: 'ENOENT',
>   syscall: 'open',
>   path: '/home/username/Documents/Coding/projectDir/\\'
> }
> 

### Expected Behavior

It should properly commit

### Affected packages

- [ ] cli
- [X] core
- [ ] prompt
- [ ] config-angular

### Possible Solution

I believe the issue is somehow those extra slashes at the end of the path are being added.

### Context

This has stopped me from commiting my code on my linux machine

### commitlint --version

^19.2.1

### git --version

V2.43.0

### node --version

v18.19.1

				// Changes related to the build process or build tools.

v20.16.0
body.11:
**Describe the issue**
The method getSchemas(String catalog, String schemaPattern) in pgjdbc's implementation of the interface DatabaseMetaData returns rows when I supply an empty string for the argument `schemaPattern`. However, no rows should be returned, because the schema name must match a non-null `schemaPattern` argument, per  java.sql interface [DatabaseMetaData](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.sql/java/sql/DatabaseMetaData.html#getSchemas(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)).

**Driver Version?** 
42.7.4

**Java Version?**
17

**PostgreSQL Version?**
13.13

**To Reproduce**
```java
ResultSet rs = connection.getMetaData().getSchemas(null, "");
if (rs.next()) {
    System.out.println("FOUND ROWS");
} else {
    System.out.println("no rows");
}
```
Output:
```
FOUND ROWS
```

**Expected behaviour**
```
no rows
```
Per java.sql interface [DatabaseMetaData](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.sql/java/sql/DatabaseMetaData.html#getSchemas(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)) getSchemas(String catalog, String schemaPattern), if the parameter `schemaPattern` is not null, then it must match the schema name as it is stored in the database:
> schemaPattern - a schema name; must match the schema name as it is stored in the database; null means schema name should not be used to narrow down the search.
body.12:
### systemd version the issue has been seen with

252

### Used distribution

Rocky 9

### Linux kernel version used

5.14.0-427.22.1.el9_4.x86_64

### CPU architectures issue was seen on

x86_64

### Component

systemd

### Expected behaviour you didn't see

Swap is disabled for all decedents of lsg.slice

### Unexpected behaviour you saw

Without `DisableControllers=memory` any decedents defaulted to `memory.swap.max` == `max` and the `lsg.slice` root had `memory.swap.max` == 0

When adding `DisableControllers=memory` decedents no longer had access to the memory controller, however, `lsg.slice` root now has `memory.swap.max` set to `max`

### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Create a slice
```cat /etc/systemd/system/lsg.slice 
Description=lsg Sliceca
Documentation=man:systemd.special(7)
DefaultDependencies=no
Before=slices.target
Requires=-.slice
After=-.slice

[Slice]
DisableControllers=memory
AllowedCPUs=8-19
AllowedMemoryNodes=1-2
MemorySwapMax=0
```
2. Assign a service unit the slice 
```[root@lsg-04.dc3 ~]# cat /etc/systemd/system/lsg@.service 
[Unit]
Description=lsg
After=...

[Service]
User=lsg
Slice=lsg.slice

WorkingDirectory=...
ExecStartPre=...
ExecStart=...

Restart=always

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```
3. `systemctl daemon-reload`
4. `systemctl restart lsg.slice` 
5. One can observe lsg unit processes are swapping and in looking in `/sys/fs/cgroup/lsg.slice/memory.swap.max` we see `max`

### Additional program output to the terminal or log subsystem illustrating the issue

```sh
# systemctl show lsg.slice |grep Swap
MemorySwapMax=0

# cat /sys/fs/cgroup/lsg.slice/memory.swap.max 
max
```

### Pandas version checks - [X] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported. - [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest version](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/whatsnew/index.html) of pandas. - [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [main branch](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/getting_started/install.html#installing-the-development-version-of-pandas) of pandas. ### Reproducible Example ```python python make.py html ``` ### Issue Description While trying to [build documentation](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/development/contributing_documentation.html#building-the-documentation) for pandas-dev, the build fails with **Sphinx parallel build error** [Stackoverflow Issue Reference](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/79062269/pandas-dev-local-setup-is-failing-when-building-documentation) ### Expected Behavior The build should be successful and the docs should be built in local ### Installed Versions

I recently started experiencing a weird error when trying to run the :Git command:

```
Error detected while processing BufReadCmd Autocommands for "fugitive://*"..function fugitive#BufReadCmd[8]..fugitive#BufReadStatus[28]..BufReadCmd Autocommands for "fugitive://*"..function fu
gitive#BufReadCmd[8]..fugitive#BufReadStatus[23]..FileType Autocommands for "*"..Syntax Autocommands for "*"..function <SNR>12_SynSet[26]..script /Users/***/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/pack
er/start/vim-fugitive/syntax/fugitive.vim:                                                                                                                                                      
line    8:                                                                                                                                                                                      
E484: Can't open file syntax/diff.vim 
```

Will appreciate any help with that issue.

Neovim v0.10.2
Fugitive @d4877e54cef67f5af4f950935b1ade19ed6b7370
MacOS
body.19:
### Bug description

We recently changed database from sqlserver to postgresql. 

As column types are different between both prisma schemas, I had to convert the old schema to the new one.

Our old columns in sqlserver were: 

ReceiveEmails Boolean? 

and the new column is:

ReceiveEmails Decimal? @db.Decimal(1, 0) @map("receiveemails")

when I run a findFirstOrThrow query, I receive this error:

Inconsistent column data: Could not convert value false of the field `receiveemails` to type `Decimal`

### How to reproduce

We are running this code in aws lambdas and this is where the error happens.

When I run the same code on my local (macOS) we get this error.


### Expected behavior

I expect to not receive an error and get the correct data back in the result

### Prisma information

```prisma
model Members {
  Id                           String             @id(map: "members_2982385") @db.VarChar(128) @map("id")
  ReceiveEmails                Decimal?           @db.Decimal(1, 0) @map("receiveemails")
  PersonId                     BigInt?            @map("personid")
  Email                        String?            @db.VarChar(256) @map("email")
}
```

```ts
await prisma.members.findFirstOrThrow({
  where: {
    Id: id
  }
})
```


### Environment & setup

- OS: MacOs
- Database: PostgreSQL
- Node.js version: 18.17.0


### Prisma Version

```
9.6.7
```
